column4: is there a way to repartition my windows hard drive so i can install ubuntu on it using a live Cd of 8.04?
: you can use  live CD without thouch win
: and you can repartition windows  with ubuntu live Cd but defragment wins few times before

: look link I give to you and on that page look for install desktop and windows
: dual boot windows and Ubuntu
ah, didnt see hte link
: np
: welcome to ubuntu

in that guide you sent me, i have one large partition, and a small 8MB unallocated partition. however, the guide shows only one partition. and further down in the install options, the guide shows a resize guided install, and i dont have that...
: wait a min,please
i can give ya screen shots if ya need it
: just time and patience and everything will be O.K. use manual way
ok, ill use manual
quick qustion about my partition in gparted: it  has a set of keys next to the partition name, is that ok?
: http://www.fs-driver.org/
: ext3 is default filesystem format in ubuntu
: just install that driver on win partition and you will see Ubuntu
: it is 3 then and I think it is too much you will be good with 2
: put it on the end of disc
